metadata.title: CVE-2024-0743 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
An unchecked return value in TLS handshake code could have caused apotentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 122,Firefox ESR < 115.9, and Thunderbird < 115.9.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-0743` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:115.9.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:115.9.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:115.9.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:115.9.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:115.9.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:115.9.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:115.9.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
mozjs78 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs91 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs102 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
